title: Risk of mixing ign-math2 and ign-math3 ABIs in gazebo8

content.raw:
This issue follows up the statement made by @traversaro in a [gazebo PR](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2588/depend-on-ign-math3/diff#comment-29577581):

*"If there is an ABI breakage between ign-math2 and ign-math3, ign-msgs functions would use ign-math2's ABI, while Gazebo would use ign-math3's ABI, with runtime errors when Gazebo is calling ign-msgs functions that use ignition::math objects."*

Given that we are exposing the same symbols in ign-math2 and ign-math3, there is a risk of ABI breakage if those are being exposed in the public interfaces of the different ignition robotics libraries.

**Short-term action:**
In order to avoid the potential risk in gazebo8, I proposed to migrate all the gazebo dependencies to ign-math3, release them and make gazebo8 to depend strictly on those versions using ign-math3 or newer.

**Proper solution:**
To avoid the binary symbol conflict we can expore the option of using [`inline namespaces`](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/namespace#Inline_namespaces) in the different ignition libraries. The method is described for [libstdc++](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/libstdc%2B%2B/manual/using_dual_abi.html) or in the [mongdb project](http://mongodb.github.io/mongo-cxx-driver/mongocxx-v3/api-abi-versioning/)
